sentences.en: ‘And he’ll believe you, will he?’ Maria taunted.
sentences.cn: “他会相信你的，对吧？”玛丽亚嘲讽道。

sentences.en: A gang taunted a disabled man.
sentences.cn: 一帮混混儿羞辱了一个残疾人。

sentences.en: By now , it was a taunt to him.
sentences.cn: 这已经成为对他的一种讽刺了.

sentences.en: DAY 752 - captors continue to taunt me with bizarre dangling objects.
sentences.cn: 第752天主人继续摇摆古怪的东西以示对我的嘲弄.

sentences.en: Don't taunt him with cowardice [ with being a coward ].
sentences.cn: 别嘲笑他胆小 [ 是懦夫 ].

sentences.en: He became a taunt to his neighbours.
sentences.cn: 他成了邻居们嘲讽的对象.

sentences.en: He would laugh at any one who tried to taunt him.
His genial sufficiency was a taunt and a mockery to many.
sentences.cn: 他那么和蔼自满的态度,许多人都认为是一种辱骂和嘲弄.

sentences.en: I like to taunt small, barking dogs in parked cars.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢逗弄在车里叫的小狗.

sentences.en: It is in bad form to taunt your opponents.
sentences.cn: 嘲笑对手是不礼貌的举动.

sentences.en: Taunt the target to attack you.
sentences.cn: 辱骂敌人,另敌人转移目标攻击你.

sentences.en: The behaviour of taunt is surprisingly simple, once you remember the 10 % rule.
sentences.cn: 当你想到10%则后会发觉嘲讽原理如此简单!
最后那句辱骂的话激怒了他.
这种侮辱使他心灵上受到严重创伤.

sentences.en: The taunt, See then whether you shall be master!
sentences.cn: 嘲弄而威吓地说, 看你能否自主!

sentences.en: Weapon taunt powers should be more effective now.
sentences.cn: 武器挑衅技能现在更加有效了.

sentences.en: Why should she taunt him this way unless she had good grounds?
sentences.cn: 除非她确实有了证据,不然她怎么会对他这样辱骂 呢 ?

trans.tran_cn: 嘲弄，奚落，讥讽，嘲弄的对象，笑柄
trans.tran_en: a remark or joke intended to make someone angry or upset
to try to make someone angry or upset by saying unkind things to them
If someone taunts you, they say unkind or insulting things to you, especially about your weaknesses or failures
